Classes in MCFZIB.h
Compile-time switches in MCFZIB.h

Classes

class  MCFZIB
 The MCFZIB class derives from the abstract base class MCFClass, thus sharing its (standard) interface, and implements both the primal and dual (revised) network simplex algorithms for solving (Linear) Min Cost Flow problems. More...

kDantzig

kFrstElA 

first eligible arc in round-robin

kMltPrPr 

Multiple Partial Pricing.

Function Documentation

◆ SetAlg()

void SetAlg ( bool  UsPrml,
char  WhchPrc 
)

Select which algorithm (Primal vs Dual Network Simplex), and which pricing rule within the algorithm, is used.

If UsPrml == true then the Primal Network Simplex algorithm is used, otherwise the Dual Network Simplex is used.

The allowed values for WhchPrc are:

  • kDantzig Dantzig's pricing rule, i.e., most violated dual constraint; this can only be used with the Primal Network Simplex
  • kFrstElA "dumb" rule, first eligible arc in round-robin;
  • kMltPrPr Multiple Partial Pricing rule.

If this method is not called, the Primal Network Simplex with the Multiple Partial Pricing rule (the best setting on most instances) is used.
